WorkItem.Description:
Implement a BIFF reader module.  BIFF, (Binary Interchange File Format) is the format used for versions Excel 11 and earlier.  I've already implemented this in a proposal for pear, but decided to propose it for this project instead.  It supports BIFF 7 & BIFF 8 formats.
Â 
By the way, might I suggest a consistent way for naming modules.  Either name the year, version or format, but not a variety of different ones ;)  Currently there's CSV, Excel5 and Excel2007.  Anyway, I suggest that this one's called PHP_Excel_Reader_BIFF or PHP_Excel_Reader_XLS.  If you name your modules after the extension or file format, then you'll be able to implement the other file formats.

Comments.Message: I'd say this one's called Excel5 :-)

Well it sounds kinda unprofessional and vague, but to follow with consistency I guess I can live with it.

This module requires an OLE class that returns a virtual stream as provided by Christian Schmidt.
It's true that this is not the best name, but it is more clear for people that there is a reader and writer with the same name...
The OLE work is being tracked here:http://www.codeplex.com/PHPExcel/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=3079
The OLE package has now been updated (see [workitem:3079]).

Is there any Excel5 reader code that's in a useable format yet?   I'd love to help test it.   I'd like to replace the really buggy excel reader I have at the moment with this one, since i'm already using it for Excel2007 files.  I'd like to make my whole system consistent.

the ExcelReader.zip that is attached is what I've been using, but I'd love to have that functionality included in a PHPExcel Reader Exel5 module.    I've found that the ExcelReader has several bugs and seems to be unable to decode the custom date formats properly which causes me some pain.

it's extremely needed for new version of PHPExcel to implement reading of old excel BIFF formats, or it won't be PHPExcel anyway....
Also parser should include metadata (like formatting) like I think. Attached in file version haven't this feature.

Is anybody planning to include it to new distr.?
If you feel like implementing this feature, please let me know.

I've made a simple PHPExcel_Reader_Excel5 by using ParseXL (with a few community patches). Really, ParseXL should have been integrated into the class but my objective was just to get Excel5 documents imported.

If you want to try it out, just put the files from the attached zip into PHPExcel/Reader.

Added in SVN.

So far it only loads the value of each cell. Sadly, this means it doesn't support loading worksheet formats or properties.
